metadata.name: Potential Meterpreter/CobaltStrike Activity
metadata.comment: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service starting

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\services.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/c')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('echo')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\pipe\\')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('cmd')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('%comspec%'))) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('rundll32')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dll,a')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/p:'))) AND NOT contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('mpcmdrun')))

output.summary: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service starting

metadata.objective: Examine fields: ComputerName, actor.user.name, process.cmd_line False positives: 1. Commandlines containing components like cmd accidentally 2. Jobs and services started with cmd References: https://speakerdeck.com/heirhabarov/hunting-for-privilege-escalation-in-windows-environment, https://blog.cobaltstrike.com/2014/04/02/what-happens-when-i-type-getsystem/
